comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -176,7 +176,7 @@
       "selectAllLabel": "Select all {resourceNamePlural}",
       "selected": "{selectedItemsCount} selected",
       "undo": "Undo",
-      "selectAllItems": "Select all {itemsLength}+ {resourceNamePlural}",
+      "selectAllItems": "Select all {resourceNamePlural} in this store",
comment.body:
Not my area of expertise, but a quick look at the code shows that [we extract the query when the selection is all](https://github.com/Shopify/web/blob/main/app/sections/Orders/OrderListCustomizable/OrderListCustomizable.tsx#L1453), which matches my expectations on how the feature should work.

cc @AndrewMusgrave, @sethomas, just in case

pull_request.title: [IndexTable] Update bulk selection copy
pull_request.body: ### WHY are these changes introduced? Fixes https://github.com/Shopify/web/issues/75434 ### WHAT is this pull request doing? This PR updates the copy in the bulk actions bar when a merchant is selecting more items than is visible. We are removing the `50+` and replacing it with more clear language to select all Xs in the store. ### 🎩 checklist - [x] Tested on [mobile](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md#cross-browser-testing) - [x] Tested on [multiple browsers](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/shopify-admin/supported-browsers) - [x] Tested for [accessibility](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Accessibility%20testing.md) - [x] Updated the component's `README.md` with documentation changes - [x] [Tophatted documentation](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting%20documentation.md) changes in the style guide

repo.description: Shopify’s design system to help us work together to build a great experience for all of our merchants.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -176,7 +176,7 @@
       "selectAllLabel": "Select all {resourceNamePlural}",
       "selected": "{selectedItemsCount} selected",
       "undo": "Undo",
-      "selectAllItems": "Select all {itemsLength}+ {resourceNamePlural}",
+      "selectAllItems": "Select all {resourceNamePlural} in this store",
comment.body:
Just curious to know if we've considered the case where the table is actually filtered (like in orders). 

Couldn't the new copy be a bit misleading since we wouldn't be selecting all orders in the store, but al orders in the store matching the existing search?
